main event: On April 21, 1967, a civilian observer reported sighting a silver-colored object approximately 12 feet in diameter on the highway in South Hill, Virginia. The object suddenly departed, leaving a column of white fire and a burned area on the road.
interesting points: The object was sighted for about 30 seconds before it left at a high speed and a brilliant flash of light,The observer noticed a flashing or pulsing light on the object as it departed,The incident involved a burned spot on the road and four small holes found the next day,The absence of sound during and after the event raised questions about the nature of the sighting and the possibility of a hoax,The witness is considered reliable, but the discovery of charred matches at the scene suggested a potential setup for the sighting.
sighted object: a silver-colored cylindrical object with a dome-shaped top
witness description: male, civilian, age 54, managing a fertilizer warehouse, considered reliable by the police and community
